_comment: Created by ianb on 08/10/2013 13:54:13 using v0.9
title: How has the number of nurses changed?
analysis_commentary: To explore this in more detail, here we look at how the number of qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff has changed. In general, the number of staff has been decreasing from September 2009 to July 2011, and since then the numbers have stabilised. In May 2010, there were 310,793 nurses compared to 307,634 in May 2013, this is a decrease of 3,159. There is also an annual fluctuation where there is a peak in November of each year when newly graduating staff join the workforce.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
